article.headline: Columbia 72, Prairie View 69
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- Matt Preston had 21 points, 11 rebounds and six assists to lead Columbia to a 72-69 win over Prairie View in the consolation game of the Office Depot Golden Bear Classic on Sunday. Dragutin Kravic added 20 points and nine rebounds for Columbia (3-6). Jeremiah Boswell scored 11 for the Lions. For all his heroics, Preston did miss two free throws that gave Prairie View (0-9) a chance to tie the game as time expired. After Prairie View's Christian Sonier hit a 3-pointer with seven seconds left to make it 72-69, Preston missed the free throws, but Kevin Cooper's 3-pointer to tie hit the back rim at the buzzer. Cooper led Prairie View with 22 points. Tyrone Nelson scored 13 and Derek Flora added 10. After a haltime tie at 36-36, Columbia took the lead for good at 64-61 on Dalen Cuff's 3-pointer with 3:54 left. The Lions outrebounded Prairie View 39-21, and also hit 26 of 31 free throws. Prairie View went to the line just 12 times, hitting nine.
